body:
I'm curious to see if the community has any ideas on server promotion and advertisement.

Clearly, "approaching Youtubers" isn't a good plan in the short term because nothing's happened so far, so I'm wondering if anyone has any other ideas that we could use to promote the server.

I know there's a few subreddits out there designed purely for server promotion but hardly anyone goes on there.

I need help with ideas..

edit: A lot of people are coming up with flaws, and that's great, but providing possible solutions would be even greater!
body_tagged:

I need help with ideas..

edit: A lot of people are coming up with flaws, and that's great, but providing possible solutions would be even greater!

replies.body:
This thread will do nothing.

I've tried to give advice on advertising the server, but it hasn't worked. The advertising here is disorganized and no matter what we say in this thread, nothing will ultimately change that. Contrary to what you believe, advertising is not a thing that effort is being poured into and it's annoying that it seems this difficult to advertise, considering it was much, much easier to put forward an effort for advertising when I was admin (someone decided to hand off my progress to a senior that went inactive, then hand it off to more inactive people) but in terms of YouTubers not only was that set, but the people who run the advertising are inexperienced with dealing with actual advertising and marketing tactics.

I see how you're trying to help, and I want to assume that a certain someone will reply to this thread countering my points and saying "please give me suggestions", but no matter how many suggestions we give it won't change who or what is running it.

I gave up on advertising and quite a bit of the community did too, we cared and nothing was done. I've expressed this in meetings, to individuals, to documents, and over the past few years even trying to help with advertising when Gillette was admin.
replies.body_tagged:
This thread will do nothing.

I've tried to give advice on advertising the server, but it hasn't worked. The advertising here is disorganized and no matter what we say in this thread, nothing will ultimately change that. Contrary to what you believe, advertising is not a thing that effort is being poured into and it's annoying that it seems this difficult to advertise, considering it was much, much easier to put forward an effort for advertising when I was admin (someone decided to hand off my progress to a senior that went inactive, then hand it off to more inactive people) but in terms of YouTubers not only was that set, but the people who run the advertising are inexperienced with dealing with actual advertising and marketing tactics.

I see how you're trying to help, and I want to assume that a certain someone will reply to this thread countering my points and saying "please give me suggestions", but no matter how many suggestions we give it won't change who or what is running it.

I gave up on advertising and quite a bit of the community did too, we cared and nothing was done. I've expressed this in meetings, to individuals, to documents, and over the past few years even trying to help with advertising when Gillette was admin.

replies.body: Promote voting and give good rewards for it
replies.body_tagged: Promote voting and give good rewards for it

replies.body:
Voting does not work and there are no substantial rewards to offer in Avicus except credits. This was briefly discussed in the past about what we could reward voters, donors, dedicated players, etc. and there's not much really worth implementing. When Avicus got featured the front page of MinecraftForums as admin, the players didn't stay at all for more than a week.

How about we add some "substance" into Avicus? It's not attractive to new players and it's quite possibly stale, which is the reason we can't keep new players as much as older ones.
replies.body_tagged:
Voting does not work and there are no substantial rewards to offer in Avicus except credits. This was briefly discussed in the past about what we could reward voters, donors, dedicated players, etc. and there's not much really worth implementing. How about we add some "substance" into Avicus? It's not attractive to new players and it's quite possibly stale, which is the reason we can't keep new players as much as older ones.

replies.body:
A thread won't kickstart it, because we've had so many threads in the past. That won't change the fact that we have ideas, but nobody is using them. This literally changes nothing in the game, nor has any of these threads changed the course of Avicus.

Sorry if I'm being harsh, but it's not enlightening the servers nor helping pave the road for anything. We have to have someone in charge who is willing to implement these ideas, not just listen to them and not give a "Hmm" response like we've been getting.

replies.body:
No, I was trying to get a gamemode rolling that playtime actually counts since not everyone wants to lose their progress in a map when they play, but nobody responded in mapdev chat and I'm not sure the devs would be willing to code it.

HCF is an oversaturated market currently in Minecraft. Nobody will play a poorer version of it here when they can go to one of the hundreds others open and have better features and a more focused community specifically for that gamemode.

replies.body: Honestly, I think we need to market ourselves as a fun and competitive obejective-based PvP network. This is really what we do, and it's unique. Also, I think players just need to spread the word to their friends. If they like what we have than they'll naturally tell other people to play. So basically what I'm saying is that we need to keep ourselves unique, but also focus on stuff that will make us appealing for new people to come to. We don't need some big ad, we need people to want to come and have their friends play too, which is a harder issue to tackle.
replies.body_tagged: Honestly, I think we need to market ourselves as a fun and competitive obejective-based PvP network. This is really what we do, and it's unique. Also, I think players just need to spread the word to their friends. If they like what we have than they'll naturally tell other people to play. So basically what I'm saying is that we need to keep ourselves unique, but also focus on stuff that will make us appealing for new people to come to. We don't need some big ad, we need people to want to come and have their friends play too, which is a harder issue to tackle.

reply_to.body:
This thread will do nothing.

I've tried to give advice on advertising the server, but it hasn't worked. The advertising here is disorganized and no matter what we say in this thread, nothing will ultimately change that. Contrary to what you believe, advertising is not a thing that effort is being poured into and it's annoying that it seems this difficult to advertise, considering it was much, much easier to put forward an effort for advertising when I was admin (someone decided to hand off my progress to a senior that went inactive, then hand it off to more inactive people) but in terms of YouTubers not only was that set, but the people who run the advertising are inexperienced with dealing with actual advertising and marketing tactics.

I see how you're trying to help, and I want to assume that a certain someone will reply to this thread countering my points and saying "please give me suggestions", but no matter how many suggestions we give it won't change who or what is running it.

I gave up on advertising and quite a bit of the community did too, we cared and nothing was done. I've expressed this in meetings, to individuals, to documents, and over the past few years even trying to help with advertising when Gillette was admin.
reply_to.body_tagged:
This thread will do nothing.

I've tried to give advice on advertising the server, but it hasn't worked. The advertising here is disorganized and no matter what we say in this thread, nothing will ultimately change that. Contrary to what you believe, advertising is not a thing that effort is being poured into and it's annoying that it seems this difficult to advertise, considering it was much, much easier to put forward an effort for advertising when I was admin (someone decided to hand off my progress to a senior that went inactive, then hand it off to more inactive people) but in terms of YouTubers not only was that set, but the people who run the advertising are inexperienced with dealing with actual advertising and marketing tactics.

I see how you're trying to help, and I want to assume that a certain someone will reply to this thread countering my points and saying "please give me suggestions", but no matter how many suggestions we give it won't change who or what is running it.

I gave up on advertising and quite a bit of the community did too, we cared and nothing was done. I've expressed this in meetings, to individuals, to documents, and over the past few years even trying to help with advertising when Gillette was admin.
